item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Blocked drain, 4th December
item.description:
The drain between lampposts 19 and 21 on the Cirencester Road, Cheltenham is still blocked despite the work carried out yesterday. The work only swept the surface and did not clear the drain which needs to be flushed through. The photograph taken this morning after light rain clearly shows that the remedial work has not been effective. The original FixMyStreet ref: is 8426764

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Cirencester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green or amber traffic light is not working problem, 4th December
item.description:
Customer states that the right-turn filter light no longer seems to be in rotation at this junction. Traffic in the filter lane, waiting to turn right, is no longer given a gap in the oncoming traffic to turn. Both directions just have the same stop/go cycle.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Timing to cross too short, 3rd December
item.description:
The green light for pedestrians is far too short/needs to be extended by at least 16 seconds to give pedestrians ample time to cross. It’s a very wide road and impossible to cross safely with current tine setting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Talbot Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Large pothole in the road in area of previous repair. A cyclist has just come off their bike due to the pothole and it not being visible as the road isn’t lit at night., 3rd December
item.description:
Directly outside 4 Kayte Cottage, Kayte Lane. Roughly opposite their front door. The pothole has cause a cyclist to come off and get injured this evening as it can’t be seen in the dark.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kayte Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
